result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark E Musgrove was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 10:55am [mo]
Defendant Mark E Musgrove in court with Attorney Charles Bennett Penwell.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State and Joint Recommendation of the Parties, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Musgrove

On Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 6 months, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety; no presence in bars or taverns
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
-- to pay restitution in the amount of $828.36 to Tincher Reality (upon the Court being provided proof of payment or Stipulation of parties the Court will rescind this condition)


Days credit for time already served: 0  days
recess: 11:12am

[MK] case called at 10:05am. 
Defendant Mark E Musgrove in court with Attorney John R. Dade (for Attorney C. Bennett Penwell).  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance. 
Attorney Dade indicates that the Defense is trying to obtain further information to provide to the State; this information may be helpful in reaching a resolution of the case.  Attorney Dade feels that the case is likely to settle. The scheduling of another Status Conference is requested.
recess 10:08am. 
[Post-Hearing Mr. Mugrove verifies to the clerk that the Stacy Lane address remains current.]

NEXT:  Status Conference on 2/16/16 at 10:00am

[MK] case called at 2:50pm. 
Defendant Mark E Musgrove in court with Attorney C Bennett Penwell.  DA Susan Happ appearss for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Musgrove verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense.

The Court requires $500 signature bond, with conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns,liquor stores 
--not to discuss this case with Shelly Fowler
--no presence at the apartment complex at 500 Blackhawk Drive
recess 2:55pm. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/14/15 at 10:20am   (2)  Status Conference on 11/24/15 at 10:00am.
